testcase.brief: First Enable mapping and then disable mapping
testcase.description:
Pre-Condition: Auth type is 802.1x User group and upid attribute mapping is defined user-group student user-attribute 10 User group mapping is not configured before User group mapping attribute is not defined before User group name attribute is defined in radius server, user1 belongs to group student radius attribute private group id is configured as 2 User profile with attribute equals user groupâ€™s attribute is defined user-profile any qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id 11 attribute 1 user-profile no-mapping qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id 12 attribute 2 user-profile student qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id 110 attribute 10 security-object test_so default-user-profile-attr 1
Test Procedure: 1: Check default mapping configuration in AP 2: Enable user group attribute mapping security-object test_so security aaa user-profile-mapping enable 3: Station(user1) connected to AP and check the user profile id 4: Disable user group attribute mapping no security-object test_so security aaa user-profile-mapping enable 5: Station(user1) connected to AP and check the user profile id 6: Enable user group attribute mapping again 7: Station(user1) connected to AP and check the user profile id

step.console: -v "hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface mgt0 hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface mgt0 vlan ${tb.vlan1}" -v "interface mgt0 native-vlan ${tb.vlan1}" -v "security-object ${ssid.name}" -v "security-object ${ssid.name} default-user-profile-attr 1" -v "security-object ${ssid.name} security aaa radius-server primary ${pub.radius1.ip} shared-secret ${pub.radius1.sharesecret} acct-port ${pub.radius1.acctport}" -v "security-object ${ssid.name} security protocol-suite wpa2-aes-8021x" -v "security-object ${ssid.name} security aaa user-profile-mapping enable" -v "ssid ${ssid.name}" -v "ssid ${ssid.name} security-object ${ssid.name}" -v "interface wifi0 ssid ${ssid.name}" -v "user-profile auto qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${tb.vlan2} attribute ${tb.vlan2}" -v "user-profile auto1 qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${tb.vlan1} attribute ${tb.vlan1}" -v "user-group student" -v "user-group student user-attribute ${tb.vlan2}"
